item.title: Hurricane Ida: New Orleans loses power as storm strikes
item.description: Forecasters say the storm, which is battering Louisiana with 150mph winds, is extremely dangerous.

item.title: Afghanistan: UK pressure over Taliban safe passage pledge
item.description: The government is seeking international support to ensure the militants allow people to leave Afghanistan.

item.title: Afghanistan: US drone strike 'eliminates airport bomb threat'
item.description: The strike on a vehicle prevented another suicide bombing by Islamic State, military officials say.

item.title: First Minister Nicola Sturgeon is self-isolating
item.description: The first minister said she had been identified as a close contact of someone who had tested positive for Covid-19.

item.title: Affordable uniforms law will miss new school year
item.description: Parents are concerned that a law to make school uniforms cheaper will not be in place for September.

item.title: Ed Asner: Lou Grant and Up actor dies aged 91
item.description: He'll be remembered for his roles as TV newsman Lou Grant and the lead voice role in Pixar hit Up.

item.title: Give UK workers four more bank holidays a year, says TUC
item.description: The trades union body says having just eight public holidays in England and Wales is "stingy" .

item.title: Yongbyon: UN says North Korea appears to restart nuclear reactor
item.description: A UN report says the reactor, which can produce plutonium for weapons, has been active since July.

item.title: Afghanistan: Pen Farthing has 'mixed emotions' after landing in UK
item.description: The former Royal Marine says he has "true deep feeling of sadness for Afghan today".

item.title: Man dies after paddleboard rescue off Hampshire coast
item.description: Emergency services were called to the coast near Exbury in the New Forest on Saturday afternoon.

item.title: Reggae pioneer Lee 'Scratch' Perry dies aged 85
item.description: Perry, a legendary singer and music producer, is known for his pioneering experiments with dub.

item.title: Mountain lion: US mother fights off animal attacking her son
item.description: She hit the animal with her bare hands as it attacked the five-year-old at their home in California.

item.title: Belgian Grand Prix a farce, says Lewis Hamilton
item.description: Lewis Hamilton criticises the Belgian Grand Prix as 'a farce' and accused Formula 1 of cynicism in the way it ran the rain-hit race.

item.title: The Papers: Afghans could fight for UK and British troops home
item.description: The continuing fallout from the evacuation of Afghanistan features on most front pages on Monday.

item.title: Why teenagers are mentoring senior Met Police officers
item.description: Three teenagers have mentored a trio of the Metâ€™s top women officers over the last six months.

item.title: Possum skin cloaks: Reviving an Aboriginal cultural tradition
item.description: Indigenous people in south-east Australia are reviving an expression of cultural identity.

item.title: US Open 2021 preview: Djokovic chases history, Murray & Osaka play, no Williams, Federer, Nadal
item.description: Novak Djokovic is the centre of attention as he bids to win an historic 21st Grand Slam men's title at a US Open missing some of the big-name stars.

item.title: Suit you sir? Not any more at some M&S stores
item.description: The retailer no longer sells men's suits at more than half of its large stores as tastes turn casual.

item.title: Japan's huge army of under-employed ex-housewives
item.description: Why women are still battling for better jobs in the world's third largest economy.

item.title: In India, growing clamour to criminalise rape within marriage
item.description: An Indian court ruled that forced sex with a spouse is not rape. Campaigners say it's time for new laws.

item.title: Cristiano Ronaldo: Man Utd fans & players celebrate CR7's return
item.description: Cristiano Ronaldo may have been in Portugal, but he was everywhere at Molineux.

item.title: Ethiopia's economy battered by Tigray war
item.description: Food prices are rising, the currency's value is falling and investor confidence is shaken.

item.title: Covid-19 in the UK: How many coronavirus cases are there in my area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: What are the holiday rules for travel to green, amber and red list countries?
item.description: A traffic light system is in place setting out rules for entering the UK

item.title: Covid: Do I have to self-isolate if I'm fully vaccinated?
item.description: Self-isolation rules have now been relaxed across the UK.

item.title: Wolverhampton Wanderers 0-1 Manchester United: Mason Greenwood hits winner
item.description: Mason Greenwood scores as Manchester United, in their first game since announcing an agreement to re-sign Cristiano Ronaldo, beat Wolves.

item.title: Cockroft's third 100m title one of seven golds for GB on day five of Paralympics
item.description: Hannah Cockroft sets a new world record to win her third consecutive T34 100m crown and claims a stunning sixth Paralympic title on day five in Tokyo.

item.title: 'Routine Old Firm outcome on day when predictions fail to come true'
item.description: Few of the pre-match predictions came to pass but the goal that won Rangers the Old Firm derby would be wearily familar to Celtic, writes Tom English.

item.title: Buttler to miss fourth India Test for birth of second child
item.description: Jonny Bairstow will keep wicket for England at the Kia Oval as Jos Buttler awaits the birth of his second child.

item.title: 'He brings serenity to the team' - Messi makes PSG debut as Mbappe hits double
item.description: Lionel Messi makes his Paris St-Germain debut as a 66th-minute substitute in a 2-0 win at Reims in Ligue 1, with Kylian Mbappe getting both goals.

item.title: Manchester United v Wolves: Should Paul Pogba have been penalised for foul?
item.description: Match of the Day 2 pundits Jermaine Jenas and Dion Dublin discuss whether Manchester United's winner in their 1-0 victory over Wolves should have been ruled out for a Paul Pogba challenge in the build-up.

item.title: Wolves 0-1 Manchester United: Ole Gunnar Solskjaer praises 'special' Mason Greenwood in hard-fought victory
item.description: Manchester United manager Ole Gunnar Solskjaer praises "special" Mason Greenwood after he scored their only goal in a 1-0 win at Wolves.

item.title: John Simpson on Afghanistan: A country abandoned
item.description: As foreign forces end their 20-year campaign, our world affairs editor considers what has been achieved.

item.title: Afghanistan: Taxi driver, shopkeeper: UK victims of Kabul attack
item.description: Relatives and friends of Mohammad Niazi and Musa Popal pay tribute after Thursday's blasts.

item.title: Afghanistan: 'Thousands more left behind...and feel terrified'
item.description: The BBC's Lyse Doucet in Kabul says many people are still desperately trying to leave, as evacuations draw to a close.

item.title: Afghanistan: Black Hawks and Humvees - military kit now with the Taliban
item.description: As the insurgents swept through Afghanistan they inherited an arsenal of US-made equipment.

item.title: Afghanistan: 'I helped the US military, now help me save my family'
item.description: Afghans living in Texas plead for help to save the lives of loved ones left behind in Afghanistan.

item.title: Afghanistan: Shukria Barakzai's whispered voice notes and dramatic escape
item.description: The desperate messages sent by Afghan politician Shukria Barakzai to a UK MP. as the Taliban tried to hunt her down.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: Who are Great Britain's medal winners?
item.description: A list of the Great Britain medal winners from the Tokyo 2020 Paralympics.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics medal table - which country has won most golds?
item.description: Which country is leading the medal table for the Tokyo 2020 Paralympics? How are Great Britain getting on?

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: What you need to know about Paralympic classification
item.description: From KL1 to PT2 and F11 to SB6 - everything you need to know about classification at the Paralympic Games.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: Sport-by-sport guide
item.description: Twenty-two sports will feature in the Tokyo Paralympics - find out more about them all here.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: Eight Great Britain athletes to watch at Games
item.description: From the 'Weirwolf' to a potential swimming star, who are some of the Great Britain athletes hoping to shine at the Tokyo Paralympics?

item.title: Bilal Sarwary: 'The plane hit the tower and all our lives changed'
item.description: Afghan journalist Bilal Sarwary was selling carpets when 9/11 happened. From that day on, everything changed.

item.title: Shot in the head in Angola, left for dead, now a Wetherspoons star
item.description: Cesar Kimbirima fled Angola after being shot four times and spending five months in a coma.

item.title: Michael Knighton: The man who could have bought Man Utd for Â£10m but walked away
item.description: In August 1989, Michael Knighton celebrated his Manchester United takeover deal at Old Trafford. But the plotting against him had just begun.

item.title: India's living dead: 'They stared at me like I was a ghost'
item.description: If you're dead you can't own land - so if someone obtains your death certificate you could lose everything.

item.title: Peter Karlsson: The painful verdict on Swedish ice hockey player's 1995 killing
item.description: Peter Karlsson was stabbed to death in the street. His killer said he was protecting himself - via the so-called 'gay panic' defence.
